EmailTemplate.name: OSS_Event_Spring IO_Barcelona_Q216.Invite 3-22-16
EmailTemplate.subject: Spring I/O 2016 keynote and agenda - May 19-20 Barcelona, Spain
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}}, Join core Spring community members and key Pivotal engineers from the Spring team in beautiful Barcelona, Spain for Spring I/O -- the European Spring community event.
Spring I/O agenda is shaping up
Almost all accepted talks have already been published on the Spring I/O 2016 site <[[http://www.springio.net/agenda/]]> and a compelling agenda and speaker lineup announced. Some of the Pivotal speakers from the Spring Team include:
Dave Syer <[[https://twitter.com/david_syer]]> - Spring Framework Lead
Gary Russell <[[https://twitter.com/gprussell/]]> - Spring Integration/AMQP Lead
Brian Clozel <[[https://twitter.com/brianclozel]]> - Spring Framework committer
Sébastien Deleuze <[[https://twitter.com/sdeleuze]]> - Spring Framework committer
Josh Long <[[https://twitter.com/starbuxman]]> - Spring Developer Advocate
They are joined by other leaders and experts from the european and international community who are speaking <[[http://springio.net/speakers]]> at the conference.
Get your ticket now before price increases on May 2, 2016
Not too much time left to enjoy the developer-friendly price of 259€. Secure your ticket <[[http://www.springio.net/]]> before 2nd of May to enjoy 2 days with 4 tracks packed with amazing talks and a selection of practical workshops.
Spring I/O keynotes
Featuring Juergen Hoeller <[[http://www.springio.net/speaker/juergen-hoeller/]]>, Stéphane Nicoll <[[http://www.springio.net/speaker/stephane-nicoll/]]> and Phil Webb <[[http://www.springio.net/speaker/phillip-webb/]]> as first day keynote speakers, presenting From Spring Framework 4.3 to 5.0 with plenty of live demos. The conference will also enjoy a second day keynote, presented by Rossen Stoyanchev <[[http://www.springio.net/speaker/rossen-stoyanchev/]]> and Stephane Maldini <[[http://www.springio.net/speaker/stephane-maldini/]]> on Designing Applications: The Reactive Way. You don’t want to miss this one!
Sponsors
Sponsors <[[http://www.springio.net/sponsors]]> are one of the things that make Spring I/O a great event. Please direct sponsor inquiries to email at events@javahispano.org <[[mailto:events@javahispano.org]]> or @spring_io <[[https://twitter.com/spring_io]]> on Twitter. Your support will make it possible for the community to gather, learn and build the future of the Spring ecosystem. Consider joining the current sponsors like Everis, Pivotal, Hdiv, Vaadin, DISID and JetBrains.
Questions
If you have any questions for the organizing team, reach out on twitter: @spring_io <[[https://twitter.com/spring_io]]> or by email at events@javahispano.org <[[mailto:events@javahispano.org]]>.
